CatDescriptText: Mrs. Ciaraso Thomas, housewife, 2903 Webster Avenue, was part of the "Pittsburghers Speak Up" column published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 28, 1959, pg. A1 with question: "Do you think the morals of the community are better than they used to be, worse or about the same? If there is any change, what do you think caused it?" answer reads: "I think that conditions are much better than they use to be.  As to why this is so, I just can't say, but I feel that this is the way things are today."
TitMainTitle: Portrait of Ciaraso Thomas wearing button down striped coat with plush collar and light colored decorative striped dress, standing in front of swirled granite wall and Lutheran Church Supply Store sign, Wood Street, Downtown
